Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Bead and ring
Description: Small tube-shaped bead of opaque white glass, pierced longitudinally at its centre. It is 0,45 cm long and 0,3 in diametre in its roundest part. It must have been an element of a lost necklace. The copper ring is irregular: it has an almost flat section and another in the shape of a misshapen semicircle with a diametre varying from 1,3 cm to 1,4 cm. It could have been a fastening claps for a piece of clothing.
